# packages/adapter-rust/vendor/codelldb/linux-arm64/lldb/lib/python3.12/site-packages/pip/_vendor/rich/terminal_theme.py
@source-hash: d63e7eb9f25f9ef9
@generated: 2026-02-09T18:01:02Z

## Purpose
Defines terminal color themes for console content export in the Rich library. Provides a centralized way to manage background, foreground, and ANSI color palettes for different terminal aesthetics.

## Key Components

### TerminalTheme Class (L9-30)
Core class representing a complete terminal color scheme:
- `__init__(L20-29)`: Accepts background/foreground RGB tuples and normal/bright color lists
- Converts RGB tuples to ColorTriplet objects for background_color and foreground_color
- Creates unified ANSI palette by combining normal and bright colors (defaults to duplicating normal if bright not provided)

### Type Definitions
- `_ColorTuple (L6)`: Type alias for RGB triplet `Tuple[int, int, int]`

## Dependencies
- `ColorTriplet` from `.color_triplet`: Wraps RGB values 
- `Palette` from `.palette`: Manages ANSI color collections

## Predefined Themes

### DEFAULT_TERMINAL_THEME (L32-55)
Standard VGA colors with white background, black foreground, and classic 8+8 ANSI color set.

### MONOKAI (L57-80)
Dark theme inspired by Monokai editor scheme with deep black background and vibrant accent colors.

### DIMMED_MONOKAI (L81-104)
Muted variant of Monokai with slightly lighter background and desaturated colors.

### NIGHT_OWLISH (L105-128)
Light theme with white background and dark blue foreground, featuring balanced color palette.

### SVG_EXPORT_THEME (L130-153)
Optimized theme for SVG export with dark gray background and carefully chosen colors for document rendering.

## Architecture Notes
- All themes follow the 8 normal + 8 bright color pattern for ANSI compatibility
- Color values are hardcoded RGB triplets for consistency
- Themes are instantiated as module-level constants for easy import and use
- Design supports both light and dark terminal environments
